item.title: Concentration of Lipschitz Functions
item.description: The content comes from Lecture 7 of Prof. Lunde’s Math5440 and Chapter 5 of High-Dimensional Probability. In first note on HDP, we introduced the bounded difference inequality, which is a result that can be applied to a wide range of problems. The bounded difference property may be thought of as a type of smoothness condition. Recall that a function $f: \mathbb{R}^d \mapsto \mathbb{R}$ is $L$-Lipschitz if the following holds for all $x, y \in \mathbb{R}^d$ , $|f(x)-f(y)| \leq L|x-y|$.

item.title: High-Dimensional Probability and Statistics II
item.description: This file is for the notes and exercises for the book Roman Vershynin’s High-Dimensional Probability, one of the references used in Prof Lunde’s Math5440. The other references are Ramon van Handel’s Probability in High Dimension and Martin J.Wainwright’s High-Dimensional Statistics. Errata and update of HDP: errata, update. Exercises solns for HDP: soln. Exercises solns for HDS: soln.

item.title: High-Dimensional Probability and Statistics I
item.description: This file is the first of the two for the notes and exercises in the book Roman Vershynin’s High-Dimensional Probability, one of the references used in Prof Lunde’s Math5440. The other references are Ramon van Handel’s Probability in High Dimension and Martin J.Wainwright’s High-Dimensional Statistics. The file contains chapter 0,1,2,3,4. The second file will contain chapter 5,7,8. Some topics will be singled out to become files of their own. Errata and update of HDP: errata, update.
